name: ARView.DebugOptions
desc: Options for drawing overlay content in a scene that aids in debugging the scene.

items.name: static let none: ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Disable all debugging overlays.

items.name: static let showPhysics: ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Draw visualizations for collision objects and rigid bodies.

items.name: static let showStatistics: ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Collect performance statistics and display them in the view.

items.name: static let showAnchorOrigins: ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Display anchor origins.

items.name: static let showAnchorGeometry: ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Display anchor geometry.

items.name: static let showWorldOrigin: ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Display a coordinate axis indicating the position and orientation of the AR world coordinate system.

items.name: static let showFeaturePoints: ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Display a point cloud showing intermediate results of the scene analysis used to track device position.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Creates an empty option set.

items.name: init<S>(S)
items.desc: Creates a new set from a finite sequence of items.

items.name: init(arrayLiteral: ARView.DebugOptions...)
items.desc: Creates a set containing the elements of the given array literal.

items.name: var isEmpty: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the set has no elements.

items.name: func contains(ARView.DebugOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given element is a member of the option set.

items.name: func insert(ARView.DebugOptions) -> (inserted: Bool, memberAfterInsert: ARView.DebugOptions)
items.desc: Adds the given element to the option set if it is not already a member.

items.name: func update(with: ARView.DebugOptions) -> ARView.DebugOptions?
items.desc: Inserts the given element into the set.

items.name: func remove(ARView.DebugOptions) -> ARView.DebugOptions?
items.desc: Removes the given element and all elements subsumed by it.

items.name: func subtract(ARView.DebugOptions)
items.desc: Removes the elements of the given set from this set.

items.name: func subtracting(ARView.DebugOptions) -> ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Returns a new set containing the elements of this set that do not occur in the given set.

items.name: func union(ARView.DebugOptions) -> ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Returns a new option set of the elements contained in this set, in the given set, or in both.

items.name: func formUnion(ARView.DebugOptions)
items.desc: Inserts the elements of another set into this option set.

items.name: func intersection(ARView.DebugOptions) -> ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Returns a new option set with only the elements contained in both this set and the given set.

items.name: func formIntersection(ARView.DebugOptions)
items.desc: Removes all elements of this option set that are not also present in the given set.

items.name: func symmetricDifference(ARView.DebugOptions) -> ARView.DebugOptions
items.desc: Returns a new option set with the elements contained in this set or in the given set, but not in both.

items.name: func formSymmetricDifference(ARView.DebugOptions)
items.desc: Replaces this set with a new set containing all elements contained in either this set or the given set, but not in both.

items.name: func isSubset(of: ARView.DebugOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set is a subset of another set.

items.name: func isStrictSubset(of: ARView.DebugOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether this set is a strict subset of the given set.

items.name: func isSuperset(of: ARView.DebugOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set is a superset of the given set.

items.name: func isStrictSuperset(of: ARView.DebugOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether this set is a strict superset of the given set.

items.name: func isDisjoint(with: ARView.DebugOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set has no members in common with the given set.
